gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਰਾਮ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਅਤਿ ਕੀਨ ਰੋਸ ॥ ਜਿਮ ਪਰਤ ਅਗਨ ਘ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਰਤ ਜੋਸ ॥
transliteration: Tab Raam Bhraat At(i) Keen Ros|| Jim Parat Agad Ghrit Karat Jos||
translation: Then Lakshman became highly infuriated and increased it with zeal like the fire blazing fiercely when the ghee is poured over it;

gurmukhi: ਗਹਿ ਬਾਣ ਪਾਣ ਤੱਜੇ ਅਨੰਤ ॥ ਜਿਮ ਜੇਠ ਸੂਰ ਕਿਰਣੈ ਦੁਰੰਤ ॥੫੧੧॥
transliteration: Gad(i) Baan Paan Tajje Anant||jim Jeth Soor Kirnai Durant||511||
translation: He discharged the scorching arrows like the terrible sunrays of eh month of Jyestha.511.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਰਣ ਅਾਪ ਮੱਧ ਬਾਹਤ ਅਨੇਕ ॥ ਬਰਣੈ ਨ ਜਾਹਿ ਕਹਿ ੲੇਕ ੲੇਕ ॥
transliteration: Bran Aao Naddg Baahat Anek|| Barnai Na Jaah(i) Kah(i) Eke K||
translation: Getting himself wounded he discharged so many arrows which are indescribable;

gurmukhi: ੳੁੱਝਰੇ ਵੀਰ ਜੁੱਝਣ ਜੁਝਾਰ ॥ ਜੈ ਸਬਦ ਦੇਵ ਭਾਖਤ ਪੁਕਾਰ ॥੫੧੨॥
transliteration: Ujjhre Veer Jujjhaan|| Jai Sabad Dev Bhaakhat Poukaar||512||
translation: These brave fighters are absorbed in fight and on the other hand, the gods are raising the sound of victory.512.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਪ ਕਰਯੋ ਸੱਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਬਿਹੀਨ ॥ ਬਹੁ ਸੱਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਬਿੱਦਿਅਾ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ॥
transliteration: Rip Daryo Sasstra Astran Biheen|| Bahu Sasstra Saastra Biddiaa Prabeen||
translation: Ultimately Lakshman deprived Atkaaye, the specialist in many sciences of weapons and arms, of his weapons and arms;

gurmukhi: ਹੱਯ ਮੁਕਟ ਸੂਤ ਬਿਨੁ ਭਯੋ ਗਵਾਰ ॥ ਕਛੁ ਚਪੇ ਚੋਰ ਜਿਮ ਬਲ ਸੰਭਾਰ ॥੫੧੩॥
transliteration: Hayy Moukat Soot Been(u) Bhyo Gadaar|| Kachh(u) Chape Chor Jim Bal Sanbhaar||513||
translation: He was deprived of his horse, crown and garments and he tried ot conceal himself like a thief mustering his strength.513.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਪ ਹਣੇ ਬਾਣ ਬੱਜ੍ਵ ਘਾਤ ॥ ਸਪ ਚਲੇ ਕਾਲ ਕੀ ਜੁਅਾਲ ਤਾਤ ॥
transliteration: Rip Hane Baan Bajjrav Ghaat|| Sam Chale Kaal Kijuaal Taat||
translation: He discharged arrows causing destruction like Indra’s Vajra and they were striking like the advancing fire of death;

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕੁਪਯੋ ਵੀਰ ਅਤਕਾੲਿ ਅੈਸ ॥ ਜਨ ਪ੍ਰਲੈ ਕਾਲ ਕੋ ਮੇਘ ਜੈਸ ॥੫੧੪॥
transliteration: Tab Koupyo Veer Atkaae Ais|| Jan Pralai Kaal Ko Megh Jais||514||
translation: The hero Atkaaye become highly infuriated like the clouds of doomsday.514.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮ ਕਰਨ ਲਾਗ ਲਪਟੈਂ ਲਬਾਰ ॥ ਜਿਮ ਜੁੱਬਣ ਹੀਣ ਲਪਟਾੲਿ ਨਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Im Karan Laag Laptain Labaar|| Jim Joubban Been Laptaae Naar||
translation: He began to prattle like a man without the energy of a youth, clinging to a woman without satisfying her,

gurmukhi: ਜਿਮ ਦੰਤ ਰਹਤ ਗਹ ਸ੍ਵਾਨ ਸਸਕ ॥ ਜਿਮ ਗੲੇ ਬੈਸ ਬਲ ਬੀਰਜ ਰਸਕ ॥੫੧੫॥
transliteration: Jim Dant Rahat Gad Svaan Sasak|| Jim Gad Bais Bal Beeraj Rasak||515||
translation: Or like a teethless dog on catching a rabbit whom he can do no harm, or like a libertine without the semen.515.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਮ ਦਰਬ ਹੀਣ ਕਛੁ ਕਰਿ ਬਪਾਰ ॥ ਜਣ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਹੀਣ ਰੁੱਝਯੋ ਜੁਝਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Jim Darab Heen Kachh(u) Kar(i) Bapaar|| Jan Sastra Heen Rujjhyo Jujhaar||
translation: Atkaaye was in such a situation which is experienced by a trader without money or a warriors without weapons.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਮ ਰੂਪ ਹੀਣ ਬੇਸਯਾ ਪ੍ਰਭਾਵ ॥ ਜਣ ਬਾਜ ਹੀਣ ਰਥ ਕੋ ਚਲਾਵ ॥੫੧੬॥
transliteration: Jim Roop Heen Besyaa Prabhaav|| Jan Baaj Heen Rath Ko Chalaav||516||
translation: He looked like and ugly prostitute or a chariot without horses.516.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਤਮਕ ਤੇਗ ਲਛਮਣ ੳੁਦਾਰ ॥ ਤਹ ਹਣਯੋ ਸੀਸ ਕਿੱਨੋ ਦੁਫਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Tab Tamak Teg Lachhman Udaar|| Tah Hanyo Sees Kinno Douphaar||
translation: Then the benevolent Lakshman stuck his sharp-edged sword and chopped the demon into two halves.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਬੀਰ ਅਤਿਕਾੲਿ ੲੇਕ ॥ ਲਖ ਤਾਹਿ ਸੂਰ ਭੱਜੇ ਅਨੇਕ ॥੫੧੭॥
transliteration: Tab Giryo Beer Atikaae Ek|| Lakh Taah(i) Soor Bhajje Anek||517||
translation: That warriors named Atkaaye fell in the battlefield and on seeing him (falling) many warriors fled away.517.
